Material used.Description: Experiments conducted using HEK293 cells overexpressing LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased kinase activity and phosphorylation of downstream targets (e.g., Rab10) observed in G2019S-expressing cells.
Reduced autophagic flux and impaired mitochondrial function in R1441C-expressing cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test and ANOVA used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels ≥ 50% above wild-type baseline for G2019S; autophagic flux ≤ 30% of wild-type for R1441C.

Material used.Description: Immunofluorescence analysis performed on HEK293 cells expressing LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased cytoplasmic aggregation of LRRK2-G2019S observed compared to wild-type.
Reduced mitochondrial localization of LRRK2-R1441C observed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2-expressing cells used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Chi-square test used for qualitative data.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No significant aggregation or localization changes compared to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Aggregation ≥ 40% of cells or localization changes ≥ 50% of wild-type.

Material used.Description: In vitro kinase activity assays performed on purified LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2-G2019S showed 2–3 fold increased kinase activity compared to wild-type.
LRRK2-R1441C showed 40–50% reduced kinase activity compared to wild-type.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Kinase-inactive LRRK2 mutant used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Z-test used for kinase activity comparisons.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 20% of wild-type range.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity ≥ 50% above or below wild-type range.
